TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DesignerAction extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Associates an action taken on an activity designer on the workflow design surface with the . This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
A designer action is a user action that is performed when you activate a designer glyph on the workflow design surface. The DesignerAction class is used to indicate your actions. The DesignerAction class is also used to add the task items by the adornment service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Invoke() cil managed

Docs.summary: Invokes the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnExecuteDesignerAction%2A> method of the activity designer associated with the current designer action.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnExecuteDesignerAction%2A> method is called when you click a validation error displayed by the activity designer on the workflow design surface.

Docs.summary: Represents the name of the property that the is associated with.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> that contains the name of the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the property editor, the property that corresponds to the PropertyName of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction> provides a visual cue that signals the presence of an associated <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction>.

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of user data associated with the designer action.
